definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Perhaps, but many entrepreneurs go through a grind-it-out phase.
sentences.chinese: 可能吧，但大部分創業者都會經歷一個艱難期。

sentences.english: Friends like capital, the more friends are the better the entrepreneur is.
sentences.chinese: 朋友尤如資本金，對創業者來說是多多益善。

sentences.english: UK entrepreneurs do not seem to fear innovation.
sentences.chinese: 英國創業者似乎不懼怕創舊。

sentences.english: Entrepeneurs are afraid of doing it. They're worried they're going to scare off future investors.
sentences.chinese: 創業者們害怕這麼做，可能會嚇跑未來的投資者。

sentences.english: "Cottage" seems to be the only way the majority of entrepreneurs.
sentences.chinese: “家庭圮圯”似乎是多數創業者的必經之墺。

sentences.english: Many new business owners greatly over-estimate the amount of money they need.
sentences.chinese: 很多創業者都高估了自己需要的創業資金數量。

sentences.english: As an entrepreneur, you need to be sensitive to that fear.
sentences.chinese: 作爲創業者，你要對這樣的潛在威脅有足夠的敏感度。

sentences.english: As an entrepreneur, your personal life and business life are interconnected.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個創業者，你的個人生活和商務活動緊密相連。

sentences.english: Entrepreneurs are romanticized as being able to rely on themselves for inspiration and figure out problems on their own.
sentences.chinese: 創業者們都喜歡靠自己去找靈感，自己解決一切問題。

sentences.english: It was then, I became an entrepreneur.
sentences.chinese: 從此，我從一個準金領階級成爲了創業者。

sentences.english: Will China be able to embrace the hurly burly of the entrepreneurial marketplace?
sentences.chinese: 中國真得能夠接受創業者市場的喧囂與強大？

sentences.english: This group of serial entrepreneurs and investors represents a new generation of wealth and power.
sentences.chinese: 這一撥創業者，投資人代表的是新一代財富和權力。

sentences.english: It was a gathering of all the finalists, of which he was one, for the title of Entrepreneur of the Year.
sentences.chinese: 這是年度創業者決賽選手的集會，他是其中之一。

sentences.english: This of course has big implications for entrepreneurs and application developers, which we will explore at the RWW Mobile Summit.
sentences.chinese: 當然，這對創業者和應用開發人員也有重要意義。

sentences.english: Venture capitalists are right to warn entrepreneurs of getting caught with their pants singed.
sentences.chinese: 風投資本家警告創業者勿“引火燒身”，這是對的。

definition: to begin an undertaking/to start a major task/to initiate/to venture/venture/entrepreneurship
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
e-commerce (abbr. for 電子商務|电子商务[dian4 zi3 shang1 wu4])/(old) to negotiate by telegram or telephone
